intro: Pasania leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited pasania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that turns white when mature, giving the species its common name. Pasania leucocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
